means: 倾向于（某种观点、意见或态度等）（与to 或 toward连用）
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 利恩绰号，瘦子，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“瘦的”(lean)
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 利恩 McLean的简称
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 利恩盖尔语姓氏的英语形式，来源于别名，含义是“矛，标枪”(spear,javelin)
[人名] [爱尔兰姓氏] 利恩盖尔语姓氏的英语形式，来源于人名，含义是“灰色的”(grey)
[财]提高伦敦银行同业贷款利率获利能力的票据

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"瘦的"之意。
means: lean ： 侧重缺少脂肪。既可能是因病而瘦，也可能因饥饿而消瘦。也指身体消瘦，但肌肉结实，身体健康。
slender ： 指身体细长、体态优美、苗条适中，多用于指女性。
slim ： 指身体的细长，体重轻不着重外形的优美，可用于不同的性别，常用于减轻体重的人。
thin ： 普通用词，指腰细、骨架窄，常因疾病或疲劳而消瘦。

sentence.Network_en: She was feeling tired and was glad to lean against him.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正感到有些疲倦，因此很高兴可以靠在他身上。

sentence.Network_cn: 把植物靠墙摆放，用泥煤盖住根部。

sentence.Network_en: It is a beautiful meat, very lean and tender.

jx.jx_en_mean: rely on or derive support from

lj.lj_ly: they have learned to lean on each other for support.
lj.lj_ls: 他们已经懂得彼此依靠，互相支持。

jx.jx_en_mean: put pressure on (someone) to act in a certain way

lj.lj_ly: a determination not to allow the majority to lean on the minority.
lj.lj_ls: 决心不让多数派给少数派施压。

jx.jx_en_mean: incline or be partial to (a view or position)

lj.lj_ly: I now lean towards sabotage as the cause of the crash.
lj.lj_ls: 我现在倾向于认为坠机原因是蓄意破坏。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hleonian, hlinian, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch leunen and German lehnen, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin inclinare and Greek klinein
Old English hlǣne, of Germanic origin

encyclopedia.content: 词语 LEAN 1 vi. 倾斜，屈身；倚，靠，依赖 vt. 使倾斜；把…靠在某种东西上 n. 倾斜，倾向 2 Lean,英文人名，不太常用 adj. 瘦的，瘦肉 3 英文名lean 长江中下游丘陵地带有一个县名兴国县，这县里有个村为小获村，村子里有个小山包，山包脚下有一小溪，成S形流出，村里人都叫这出口为狮子湾。半山腰上，有一个户人家，门口种有一片板栗树，院子前立一扁，题字为乐安山庄，山庄里鸟语花香，山清水秀，此山庄住一小伙，小学时，遇

entry.def: When you lean in a particular direction, you bend your body in that direction.

example.ex: Eileen leaned across and opened the passenger door...
example.tran: 艾琳倾身把后座门打开。

example.ex: He leaned forward to give her a kiss...

entry.def: If you lean on or against someone or something, you rest against them so that they partly support your weight. If you lean an object on or against something, you place the object so that it is partly supported by that thing.

example.ex: She was feeling tired and was glad to lean against him...
example.tran: 她正感到有些疲倦，因此很高兴可以靠在他身上。

example.ex: Lean the plants against a wall and cover the roots with peat...
example.tran: 把植物靠墙摆放，用泥煤盖住根部。

entry.def: If you describe someone as lean, you mean that they are thin but look strong and healthy.

example.ex: Like most athletes, she was lean and muscular...
example.tran: 跟大部分运动员一样，她身形清瘦，肌肉结实。

example.ex: She watched the tall, lean figure step into the car.
example.tran: 她看着那个瘦高个儿上了车。

entry.def: If meat is lean, it does not have very much fat.

example.ex: It is a beautiful meat, very lean and tender.
...the leanest ground beef you can get.
example.tran: 买得到的最瘦的碎牛肉

entry.def: If you describe an organization as lean, you mean that it has become more efficient and less wasteful by getting rid of staff, or by dropping projects which were unprofitable.

example.ex: The value of the pound will force British companies to be leaner and fitter.
example.tran: 英镑目前的汇率将迫使英国公司厉行精兵简政。

example.ex: ...cutting corporate flab and building leaner companies.
example.tran: 削减企业赘肉，建立瘦身型公司

entry.def: If you describe periods of time as lean, you mean that people have less of something such as money or are less successful than they used to be.

example.ex: With fewer tourists in town, the taxi trade is going through its leanest patch for 30 years.
example.tran: 随着城里游客的减少，出租车行业正遭受30年来最不景气的时期。

means.word_mean: 1. the property possessed by a line or surface that departs from the vertical;

sentences.sentence: "the ship developed a list to starboard"
"he walked with a heavy inclination to the right"

means.word_mean: 1. to incline or bend from a vertical position;

sentences.sentence: "He leaned his rifle against the wall"

means.word_mean: 3. have a tendency or disposition to do or be something; be inclined;

sentences.sentence: "She tends to be nervous before her lectures"

means.word_mean: 5. cause to lean to the side;

sentences.sentence: "you can't be too rich or too thin"
"Yon Cassius has a lean and hungry look"-Shakespeare

means.word_mean: 2. lacking in mineral content or combustible material;

example.en: I'm leaning forward in the saddle for him to write me a good cheerful letter.
example.zh: 我热切渴望他给我写一封很开心的信。

example.en: Do you have a little lean green you could loan me?
example.zh: 你手头有没有一点钱可以借给我？

Sentence.sentence: Human control of fire goes back far enough (over a million years) that evolution could have produced a genetic leaning towards fire as a central aspect of human life.
Many firms will die, but the survivors will emerge leaner and stronger than before.

As part of the Kids Live Well campaign-expected to be announced nationwide Wednesday—participating restaurants must promise to offer at least one children's meal that has fewer than 600 calories(卡路里), no soft drinks and at least two items from the following food groups: fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins or low-fat dairy.

sentences.en: The postbox leans a little bit.
The teacher was leaned out by his long illness.
sentences.cn: 长年生病使这位老师变得消瘦。

means.word_mean: 瘦的; 少脂肪的；瘦且健康的

sentences.en: He has a lean handsome face.
In recent years, the cinema has fallen on lean times.
sentences.cn: 近几年, 电影业遇上了不景气时期。

means.word_mean: 倾向于(某种观点、意见或态度等)(与to 或 toward连用)

sentences.en: In his political opinions he leans toward the Labour Party.

jushi.english: The building leaned before it was renovated.
jushi.chinese: 在修复前,那栋楼倾斜着。

jushi.english: That wall leans so much it might fall over.
jushi.chinese: 那堵墙倾斜得很厉害,有可能倒塌。

jushi.english: The post leans a little bit.
